occurrences.text: this morning, that as Bible believers, our hope is not in the White House. Sometimes I fear that we say that but don't really believe that. Our hope is not in the White House. Our hope is not in the State House. Our hope is not in Wall Street. Our hope is in Jesus Christ, who is King of Kings. And for that, we trust Him. We trust Him. We come to that place where we say, I'm trusting the Lord, that His plan is perfect, that He knows what He is doing. Blessed, in Psalm 2, in verse number 12, blessed are all they that put their trust in Him. Psalm 20, in verse number 7, some trust in chariots and some in horses, but we will remember the name of the Lord our God. Listen, don't be putting your trust and confidence in the wrong thing. Isaiah talks about the fact that they were trusting in Egypt. That's the picture of the world. They weren't trusting the living God. They were trusting in Egypt. Jeremiah 17, in verse number 7, it says, blessed is the man that trusteth in the Lord and whose hope the Lord is. occurrences.sermon_title: "The Lord Is King For Ever And Ever" Psalm 10:16
